Replace.Text: Enabling this option removes barbarians; by extension, it also overrides any 'Hostile Villagers' options, and removes hostile villagers entirely.
Enabling this option removes Tribal Villages; by extension, it also overrides the Goody Hut picker, and any other reward-related options.
Enabling this option prevents any reward from being granted more than once by the same Tribal Village.
Enabling this option gives most available Goody Hut rewards a roughly equal chance of appearing. Will be ignored if 'No Tribal Villages' is enabled.
Enabling this option prevents goodies from being received from the meteor strike event.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For Gathering Storm ruleset.
Controls whether the various Villager Totem buildings are unlocked and buildable at game start.
For all Major Players, the ability to construct a particular Villager Totem building must first be unlocked by receiving the corresponding reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is the default setting.

Human Major Players begin the game with the ability to construct all available Villager Totem buildings. For AI Major Players, the ability to construct a particular Villager Totem building must first be unlocked by receiving the corresponding reward.

AI Major Players begin the game with the ability to construct all available Villager Totem buildings. For Human Major Players, the ability to construct a particular Villager Totem building must first be unlocked by receiving the corresponding reward.
All Major Players begin the game with the ability to construct all available Villager Totem buildings.
Controls the amount of units and citizens provided by the various free unit and population rewards.
Free unit and population rewards will always provide 1 unit or citizen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is the default setting.
Free unit and population rewards will have a 1-in-20 chance of providing 2 units or citizens; they will otherwise provide 1 unit or citizen.
Free unit and population rewards will have a 1-in-10 chance of providing 2 units or citizens; they will otherwise provide 1 unit or citizen.
Free unit and population rewards will have a 1-in-6 chance of providing 2 units or citizens; they will otherwise provide 1 unit or citizen.
Free unit and population rewards will have a 1-in-4 chance of providing 2 units or citizens; they will otherwise provide 1 unit or citizen.
Free unit and population rewards will have a 1-in-2 chance of providing 2 units or citizens; they will otherwise provide 1 unit or citizen.
Free unit and population rewards will always provide 2 units or citizens.
Choose the maximum total number of reward(s) which can potentially be provided by each Tribal Village.
Zero (0) bonus rewards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is the default setting.

Choose whether Hostile Villagers may appear [COLOR_Blue]AFTER[ENDCOLOR] receiving any Tribal Village reward(s).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When enabled, there is a chance for hostile villagers to appear following all successfully granted rewards from a Goody Hut.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This chance increases with the selected difficulty level, the current Game or Player Era, and the rarity value(s) of any granted reward(s). It is further modified by the manner in which any rewards are supplied and/or any units which receive any rewards.
Hostile Villagers will [COLOR_RED]NOT[ENDCOLOR] appear after receiving all allotted Tribal Village rewards.

Hostile Villagers will [COLOR_Blue]POSSIBLY[ENDCOLOR] appear after receiving all allotted Tribal Village rewards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Blue]IF[ENDCOLOR] they appear, villager hostility will be capped by the cumulative rarity of any received reward(s).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is the default setting.

Hostile Villagers will [COLOR_MEDIUM_GREEN]ALWAYS[ENDCOLOR] appear after receiving all allotted Tribal Village rewards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_MEDIUM_GREEN]WHEN[ENDCOLOR] they appear, villager hostility will be capped by the cumulative rarity of any received reward(s).

Hostile Villagers will [COLOR_MEDIUM_GREEN]ALWAYS[ENDCOLOR] appear after receiving all allotted Tribal Village rewards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Villager hostility will be elevated beyond normal limits, and they will react with [COLOR_Civ6DarkRed]EXTREME[ENDCOLOR] aggression regardless of any received reward(s).
The minimum game Turn in which Hostile Villagers may appear, whether as or after a reward.
Hostile Villagers may appear beginning on Turn 2.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is the default setting.
Hostile Villagers may appear beginning on Turn 5.
Hostile Villagers may appear beginning on Turn 10.
Choose which Goody Hut reward(s) have a chance of appearing.
Choose the distribution of Goody Huts on the map.
Generic description for the dummy reward.

Tier 1 (Common) Abilities-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward earns +1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] sight.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Abilities-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward earns +20 [ICON_Damaged] healing per turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.

Tier 3 (Rare) Abilities-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward earns +1 [ICON_Movement] movement.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Abilities-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward earns +10 [ICON_Strength] combat strength in all situations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.
Tier 1 (Common) Civics-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_CivicBoosted] Civic boost.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Civics-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) free [ICON_CivicBoosted] Civic boosts.
Tier 3 (Rare) Civics-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Civic.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Civics-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) free Civics.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched Code of Laws.
Tier 1 (Common) Envoys-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_Envoy] Envoy.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Envoys-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) free [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
Tier 3 (Rare) Envoys-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive three (3) free [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Envoys-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive four (4) free [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Faith-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.
Tier 3 (Rare) Gold-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one hundred twenty (120) [ICON_Gold].

Tier 4 (Legendary) Gold-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free additional [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.
Tier 1 (Common) Goodyhuts-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The villagers reveal the location of one (1) previously unknown tribal village.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Goodyhuts-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The villagers reveal the locations of two (2) previously unknown tribal villages.
Tier 3 (Rare) Goodyhuts-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The villagers reveal the locations of three (3) previously unknown tribal villages.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Goodyhuts-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The villagers reveal the locations of four (4) previously unknown tribal villages.

Tier 1 (Common) Hostiles-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One (1) [ICON_Barbarian] hostile unit will appear nearby, if there is a valid plot in which to place it. This could be a land unit or a naval unit. Any unit that appears will be the most advanced of its class that nearby resources and Barbarian technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Hostiles-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Up to two (2) [ICON_Barbarian] hostile units will appear nearby, if there are enough valid plots in which to place them. These could be land units, naval units, or a combination of both. Any units that appear will be the most advanced of their classes that nearby resources and Barbarian technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 3 (Rare) Hostiles-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Up to three (3) [ICON_Barbarian] hostile units will appear nearby, if there are enough valid plots in which to place them. These could be land units, naval units, or a combination of both. Any units that appear will be the most advanced of their classes that nearby resources and Barbarian technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Hostiles-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Up to four (4) [ICON_Barbarian] hostile units will appear nearby, if there are enough valid plots in which to place them. These could be land units, naval units, or a combination of both. Any units that appear will be the most advanced of their classes that nearby resources and Barbarian technology allow for the current Era.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The villagers will also attempt to create a new [ICON_Barbarian] barbarian outpost nearby.

Tier 1 (Common) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] recon unit in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District. Any granted unit(s) will be the most advanced that Player resources and technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] melee unit in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District. Any granted unit(s) will be the most advanced that Player resources and technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] ranged unit in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District. Any granted unit(s) will be the most advanced that Player resources and technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] anti-cavalry unit in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District. Any granted unit(s) will be the most advanced that Player resources and technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 3 (Rare) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] heavy cavalry unit in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District. Any granted unit(s) will be the most advanced that Player resources and technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 3 (Rare) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] light cavalry unit in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District. Any granted unit(s) will be the most advanced that Player resources and technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] support unit in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District. Any granted unit(s) will be the most advanced that Player resources and technology allow for the current Era.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] siege unit in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District. Any granted unit(s) will be the most advanced that Player resources and technology allow for the current Era.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Military-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] Military Engineer in a nearby plot, or in a random City's Encampment or City Center District.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Policies-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) additional [ICON_Policy] military policy slot beyond what your selected government provides.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward can be received a maximum of one time per Era.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched Political Philosophy.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Policies-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) additional [ICON_Policy] economic policy slot beyond what your selected government provides.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward can be received a maximum of one time per Era.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched Political Philosophy.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Policies-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) additional [ICON_Policy] diplomatic policy slot beyond what your selected government provides.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward can be received a maximum of one time per Era.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched Diplomatic Service.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Policies-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) additional [ICON_Policy] wildcard policy slot beyond what your selected government provides.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward can be received a maximum of one time per Era.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched Political Philosophy.

Tier 1 (Common) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward will gain twenty-five percent (25%) of the experience points needed for its next [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward will gain fifty percent (50%) of the experience points needed for its next [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.

Tier 3 (Rare) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward will gain seventy-five percent (75%) of the experience points needed for its next [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward will gain one hundred percent (100%) of the experience points needed for its next [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Promotions-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any valid unit that receives this reward will be "upgraded" to the next unit in its promotion class [COLOR_GREEN]IF[ENDCOLOR] it has a valid upgrade path.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any "upgraded" unit will retain any abilities it previously had and any veteran name it was previously assigned.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Any "upgraded" unit will gain one hundred percent (100%) of the experience points needed to earn its first promotion; any previously earned promotions will be stored when the unit is "upgraded" and can be reapplied.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward requires village discovery by one or more units, and will not be provided when the discovery method is border expansion.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive the ability to construct the [ICON_Buildings] Amenities Totem building, which provides +4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this ability has previously been granted, instead receive a free [ICON_Buildings] Amenities Totem building in a City that does not already have one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive the ability to construct the [ICON_Buildings] Culture Totem building, which provides +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this ability has previously been granted, instead receive a free [ICON_Buildings] Culture Totem building in a City that does not already have one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive the ability to construct the [ICON_Buildings] Faith Totem building, which provides +4 [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this ability has previously been granted, instead receive a free [ICON_Buildings] Faith Totem building in a City that does not already have one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive the ability to construct the [ICON_Buildings] Diplomacy Totem building, which provides +4 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this ability has previously been granted, instead receive a free [ICON_Buildings] Diplomacy Totem building in a City that does not already have one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive the ability to construct the [ICON_Buildings] Food Totem building, which provides +4 [ICON_Food] Food.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this ability has previously been granted, instead receive a free [ICON_Buildings] Food Totem building in a City that does not already have one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive the ability to construct the [ICON_Buildings] Gold Totem building, which provides +8 [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this ability has previously been granted, instead receive a free [ICON_Buildings] Gold Totem building in a City that does not already have one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive the ability to construct the [ICON_Buildings] Production Totem building, which provides +4 [ICON_Production] Production.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this ability has previously been granted, instead receive a free [ICON_Buildings] Production Totem building in a City that does not already have one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 5 (Mythic) Secrets-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive the ability to construct the [ICON_Buildings] Science Totem building, which provides +4 [ICON_Science] Science.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this ability has previously been granted, instead receive a free [ICON_Buildings] Science Totem building in a City that does not already have one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 1 (Common) Survivors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free additional [ICON_Citizen] Population in one or more random Cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Survivors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] Builder in a nearby plot, or in a random City's City Center District.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 3 (Rare) Survivors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] Trader in a random City's City Center District.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Survivors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive at least one (1) free [ICON_Unit] Settler in a nearby plot, or in a random City's City Center District.
Tier 1 (Common) Techs-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_TechBoosted] Technology boost.
Tier 2 (Uncommon) Techs-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) free [ICON_TechBoosted] Technology boosts.
Tier 3 (Rare) Techs-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free Technology.
Tier 4 (Legendary) Techs-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) free Technologies.

Tier 1 (Common) Governors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive one (1) free [ICON_Governor] Governor Title.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Governors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive two (2) free [ICON_Governor] Governor Titles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 3 (Rare) Governors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive three (3) free [ICON_Governor] Governor Titles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Governors-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive four (4) free [ICON_Governor] Governor Titles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you do not have at least one (1) City.

Tier 1 (Common) Resources-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive ten (10) of the most advanced strategic resource you have access to.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched either Animal Husbandry or Bronze Working.

Tier 2 (Uncommon) Resources-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive twenty (20) of the most advanced strategic resource you have access to.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched either Animal Husbandry or Bronze Working.

Tier 3 (Rare) Resources-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive thirty (30) of the most advanced strategic resource you have access to.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched either Animal Husbandry or Bronze Working.

Tier 4 (Legendary) Resources-type reward.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive fifty (50) of the most advanced strategic resource you have access to.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This reward will not be provided when you have not yet researched either Animal Husbandry or Bronze Working.
